data.text: @JohBjelke @RDay1979 @Peter_Strachan @perthnow Building the land up narrows the channel, so all it is likely to achieve is to raise flood levels to inundate even more land than is currently the case.
@perthnow ABSOLUTELY. SICK OF. THESE CHANGING RULES. THAT. CONSTANTLY. CHANGE. CLOWN. McGOWAN !!!!! OPEN. YOUR. BLOODY. EYES AND. YOR. EARS !!!!! YOU THINK. YOU ARE “TOP. DOG” …..  WRONG AGAIN !!!!!!
@GeochemOz @Peter_Strachan @perthnow Sydney's run out of land. Melbourne being overdeveloped to breaking point. Perth, Adelaide and Brisbane are next on the development list
@scoota_craig @WatersW40540552 @perthnow WA has insufficient water to accommodate an influx of people like what they want, along with housing and general infrastructure
@neil_daws @perthnow Nowhere for eastern staters to live in Perth! ....shame

@BecDellaS @Jen_D_Oa @perthnow Hear hear. I think McGowan has done extremely well managing the pandemic, I haven't seen my brother who lives in Melbourne for 3 years but we keep in touch, won't be long now and I'm glad we're all relatively safe 🙂

@erinfogarty20 @Jen_D_Oa @perthnow Let the haters hate. You can’t please all the people all the time. I also think that he is doing a fantastic job in protecting us. I feel sorry for the people stuck in the east  But would rather feel sorry for them than watch my family get sick and mainly die.

@Eurovisionfan04 @perthnow Where as I travelled interstate many times over the last 2 years without issue. I did so while case numbers were low.

We all knew there was risk travelling during a pandemic. The fact that people travelled during an outbreak and got stuck doesn't make what I said any less true.
@SteveToeke @perthnow Give me a spell you idiot.
